intro: Silene otites, commonly known as the red sanders or red sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of North America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Silene otites has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments.
